etymology.description: 人民 + 日报 = the people + daily (newspaper).
etymology.interpretation: Title means a daily newspaper for the people; in usage it names a major national newspaper in mainland China. Functions as a proper noun referring to that publication.
etymology.simplification: 報 → 报 per PRC character simplification to reduce strokes; other characters unchanged.

parts.english: daily newspaper; daily report; daily bulletin

examples.chinese: 我每天读《人民日报》(我每天讀《人民日報》)。
examples.english: I read the People’s Daily every day.

examples.chinese: 这篇社论刊登在《人民日报》上(這篇社論刊登在《人民日報》上)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piān shèlùn kāndēng zài 《Rénmín Rìbào》 shàng.
examples.english: This editorial was published in the People’s Daily.

examples.chinese: 《人民日报》发行量很大(《人民日報》發行量很大)。
examples.english: The People’s Daily has a large circulation.
